title: Week 1: Introduction to AI and Overview
description: An introduction to Artificial Intelligence, defining key concepts and exploring its significance.

title: Week 2: Machine Learning Basics
description: Fundamentals of machine learning, including algorithms and methods for building predictive models.

title: Week 3: Deep Learning
description: An overview of deep learning principles, architectures, and applications.

title: Week 4: Natural Language Processing
description: Foundational concepts in natural language processing and its importance in AI.

title: Week 5: Case Studies in AI
description: Analysis of AI applications across various industries through selected case studies.

title: Week 6: Midterm Review and Exam
description: Review of course materials followed by the midterm exam to assess foundational knowledge.

title: Week 7: Ethical Considerations in AI
description: Discussion of ethics in AI, focusing on issues like bias, accountability, and societal impacts.

title: Week 8: Frameworks for AI Development
description: Overview of tools and frameworks critical for AI development, including TensorFlow and PyTorch.

title: Week 9: Hands-on Workshop: Building a Model
description: Practical coding session where students implement AI models using provided datasets.

title: Week 10: Team Project Work Day
description: Collaborative session dedicated to team project development and planning.

title: Week 11: Project Presentations
description: Presentation of group projects, showcasing team efforts and findings.

title: Week 12: Future Trends in AI
description: Exploration of emerging technologies and research trends within the field of AI.

title: Week 13: Course Wrap-Up and Review
description: Final discussions revisiting key concepts and preparing for the last assessments.

title: Week 14: Final Exam Preparation
description: A dedicated session for reviewing topics in preparation for the final exam.

title: Week 15: Final Exam
description: Assessment conducted to evaluate the comprehensive understanding of the course material.
